mdRecord.dcterms:description: Also known as Fryer's Cottage. Built 1878-79 by William L. Cummings. Added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1970 as part of the Cape May Historic District, and then listed as a National Historic Landmark District in 1976. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cape_May_Historic_District Frank Furness and George Hewitt, architects. -- Bassett, William B. HISTORIC AMERICAN BUILDINGS SURVEY OF NEW JERSEY. Newark, New Jersey Historical Society, 1977. p. 28 [work]
